APPENDIX B - BOND ISSUANCES[1] 
ORDINANCE NUMBER 1329 
    "AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF PUBLIC LIBRARY BONDS IN THE SUM OF TWO HUNDRED EIGHTY THOUSAND ($280,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS; PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 24th day of April, 1956, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified property taxpaying voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of Two Hundred Eighty Thousand ($280,000.00) Dollars, provided funds for the purpose of Acquiring a Site for and Constructing, Equipping and Furnishing a Public Library Building, and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board, at said election there were cast by the qualified, property, taxpaying voters of said City 1393 votes, of which 832 were in favor of and 559 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 2 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified property taxpaying voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
    SECTION 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City, in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of Two Hundred Eighty Thousand ($280,000.00) Dollars, which said bonds shall be designated Public Library Bonds, and shall be Two Hundred Eighty in number, numbered One to Two Hundred Eighty, both inclusive, of the denomination of One Thousand Dollars, each; shall be dated December 1st, 1959, and become due and payable as follows: $28,000.00 on December 1st, in each of the years, 1961 to 1970, both inclusive and bear interest from their date until paid as follows: 
1961 through 1965 maturities-31/2 per cent per annum; and 
1966 through 1970 maturities-33/4 per cent per annum; 
such interest payable semi-annually on the 1st day of June and December, in each year, except the first coupon shall mature on the 1st day of June, 1961, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York; or, in the event of the discontinuance of such Agency, then at the Manufacturers Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    SECTION 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
PUBLIC LIBRARY BONDS OF 1959 
Number _____       $1,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: 
    That the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of One Thousand Dollars on the 1st day of December, A. D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually, on the 1st day of June and December, in each year, except the first coupon shall mature on the 1st day of June, A. D., 1961; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of such Agency, then at the Manufacturers Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT, AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue numbered from One to Two Hundred Eighty, both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to date of maturity and rate of interest, aggregating the principal sum of Two Hundred Eighty Thousand ($280,000.00) Dollars, and is issued for the purpose of Acquiring a Site for and Constructing, Equipping and Furnishing a Public Library Building, to be owned exclusively by said City, under Section 27, of Article 10, of the Constitution and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, complementary, supplementary, and enacted pursuant thereto. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions, and things required to be done, precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond, and the series of which it forms a part, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the seal thereof and dated the 1st day of December, A. D., 1959.

    SECTION 3. That each of said bonds shall be signed by the Mayor with the corporate seal of said City affixed thereto and attested by the City Clerk of said City, and each of said interest coupons shall be executed by the lithographed facsimile signatures of said Mayor and City Clerk; that said officers be and are hereby authorized and directed to cause said bonds and interest coupons to be prepared and to execute the same for and on behalf of said City; have the same registered by the City Treasurer, endorsed by the County Clerk and County Attorney, and presented to the Attorney General, Ex-Officio Bond Commissioner, together with a certified transcript of all proceedings had in connection with their issue, for his approval and endorsement; that thereupon said bonds shall be delivered to the purchasers, The R. J. Edwards, Inc., Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, Okla., and Leon L. Davis, upon payment of the purchase price thereof, which shall not be less than par and accrued interest. 
    The proceeds derived from the sale of said bonds shall be placed in a special fund and used solely for the purpose of providing funds for the purpose set out in Section 2 hereof. 
    SECTION 4. That beginning with the year 1960, a continuing annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on said bonds when due and for the purpose of providing a sinking fund with which to pay the principal of said bonds when due shall be and is hereby ordered levied upon all taxable property of said City, in addition to all other taxes, and sinking fund to be designated. 
    "The Public Library Bonds of 1959 Sinking Fund". Said tax shall be and is hereby ordered certified, levied and extended upon the tax rolls and collected by the same officers, in the same manner and at the same time as the taxes for general purposes in each of said years are certified, levied, extended and collected; that all funds derived from said tax shall be placed in said sinking fund, which, together with all interest collected on same, shall be irrevocably pledged to the payment of the interest on and principal of said bonds when and as the same fall due. 
    SECTION 5. That by reason of said City being without an adequate Public Library Building it is deemed and hereby declared necessary for the preservation of the public health, peace and safety, that said bonds shall be issued without delay, and to that end that this Ordinance shall become operative immediately; wherefore an emergency is hereby declared to exist and this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect immediately from and after its passage, approval, and publication. 
    PASSED the 6th day of October, A. D., 1959.

    (PUBLISHED IN THE DAILY ARDMOREITE THIS 8TH DAY OF OCTOBER, 1959) 
ORDINANCE NO. 1494 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF SERIES A WATERWORKS BONDS IN THE SUM OF SIX HUNDRED THOUSAND ($600,000.00) DOLLARS (BEING A PART OF A TOTAL AUTHORIZED ISSUE OF $1,381,000.00) BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 15th day of December, 1964, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified property taxpaying voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of One Million, Three Hundred Eighty-one Thousand ($1,381,000.00) Dollars to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the water system, to be owned exclusively by said City; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the qualified property taxpaying voters of said City, 2,659 votes, of which 2,133 were in favor of and 521 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 5 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified property taxpaying voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    WHEREAS, on the 4th day of January, 1965, the City Commission of the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, in regular session, did consider and adopt a Resolution wherein it was adjudged by the City Commission that it was for the best interests of the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, that only $600,000.00 bonds be sold at this time. Said Resolution further provided that said $600,000.00 of the total authorized issue of $1,381,000.00 be designated "Series A Waterworks Bonds" and said bonds were duly sold on the 26th day of January, 1965. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of Six Hundred Thousand ($600,000.00) Dollars, which said bonds shall be designated, "Series A Waterworks Bonds of 1965," and shall be one hundred twenty in number, numbered One to One Hundred Twenty, both inclusive, shall be dated on April 1, 1965, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each and become due and payable and bear interest from their date until paid as follows: 
$30,000.00 on April 1 in each of the years 1967 to 1971, inclusive, at 3% per annum 
$30,000.00 on April 1 in each of the years 1972 to 1978, inclusive, at 2 7/8 % per annum 
$30,000.00 on April 1 in each of the years 1979 and 1980 at 2.95% per annum 
$30,000.00 on April 1 in each of the years 1981 to 1983, inclusive, at 3% per annum 
$30,000.00 on April 1 in each of the years 1984 and 1985 at 3.05% per annum 
$30,000.00 on April 1, 1986 at 3.10% per annum. 
    Such interest shall be payable semi-annually on the 1st day of April and October in each year; except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of April, 1966, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
SERIES A WATERWORKS BOND OF 1965 
No. _____       $5,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, in the State of Oklahoma, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of FIVE THOUSAND ($5,000.00) DOLLARS, on the 1st day of April, A. D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually on the 1st day of April and October of each year, except the first coupon is due April 1, 1966; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue designated Series A Waterworks Bonds of 1965, in the aggregate amount of $600,000.00, being part of a total authorized issue of $1,381,000.00, numbered from One to One Hundred Twenty, both inclusive, of like date and tenor except as to date of maturity and rate of interest, and is issued for the purpose of extending and improving the water system, to be owned exclusively by said City, under Section 27, of Article 10 of the Constitution and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, complementary, supplementary and enacted, pursuant thereto. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions and things required to be done precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond and the series of which it forms a part, and the unissued portion of said authorized issue, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF, said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the seal thereof this 1st day of April, A. D., 1965.

OFFICE OF ATTORNEY-GENERAL 
BOND DEPARTMENT 
________, 19___. 
    I hereby certify that I have examined a certified copy of the record of proceedings taken preliminary to and in the issuance of the within bond; that such proceedings and such bond show lawful authority for the issue and are in accordance with the forms and methods of procedure prescribed and provided by me for the issuance of bonds of like kind; and that said bond is a valid and binding obligation according to its tenor and terms, and under the provisions of Title 62, Oklahoma Statutes 1961, Sections 11, 13 and 14, requiring the certificate of the bond commissioner of the State of Oklahoma thereon, is incontestable in any court in the State of Oklahoma unless suit thereon shall be brought in a court having jurisdiction of the same within thirty days from the date of the approval of said bond appearing in the caption hereto. 
_____
Attorney-General, Ex-Officio 
Bond Commissioner of the 
State of Oklahoma 
    Section 3. That each of said bonds shall be signed by the Mayor and the corporate seal of said City affixed thereto and attested by the City Clerk of said City and each of said interest coupons shall be executed by the lithographed facsimile signatures of said Mayor and City Clerk; that said officers be and are hereby authorized and directed to cause said bonds and interest coupons to be prepared and to execute the same for and on behalf of said City; have the same registered by the City Treasurer, endorsed by the County Clerk and County Attorney, and presented to the Attorney-General, Ex-Officio Bond Commissioner, together with a certified transcript of all proceedings had in connection with their issue, for his approval and endorsement; that thereupon said bonds shall be delivered to the purchasers, The First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City and The First National Bank and Trust Company of Ardmore upon payment of the purchase price thereof, which shall not be less than par and accrued interest. 
    The proceeds derived from the sale of said bonds shall be placed in a special fund and used solely for the purpose of providing funds for the purpose set out in Section 2 hereof. 
    Section 4. That beginning with the year 1965, a continuing annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on said bonds when due and for the purpose of providing a sinking fund with which to pay the principal of said bonds when due shall be and is hereby ordered levied upon all taxable property of said City, in addition to all other taxes, said sinking fund to be designated, "The Series A Waterworks Bonds of 1965, Sinking Fund." Said tax shall be and is hereby ordered certified, levied and extended upon the tax rolls and collected by the same officers, in the same manner and at the same time as the taxes for general purposes in each of said years are certified, levied, extended and collected; that all funds derived from said tax shall be placed in said sinking fund, which, together with all interest collected on same, shall be irrevocably pledged to the payment of the interest on and principal of said bonds when and as the same fall due. 
    Section 5. That by reason of said City being without adequate waterworks facilities, it is deemed and hereby declared necessary for the preservation of the public health, peace and safety, that said bonds be issued without delay and to that end that this Ordinance shall become operative immediately; wherefore an emergency is hereby declared to exist and this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect immediately from and after its passage, approval and publication. 
    Passed the 1st day of February, A. D. 1965. 
    Approved the 1st day of February, A. D., 1965.

ORDINANCE NO. 1500 
"AND ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF OVERPASS BONDS IN THE SUM OF THREE HUNDRED THOUSAND ($300,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 16th day of March, 1965, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of Three Hundred Thousand ($300,000.00) Dollars to provide funds for the purpose of constructing an overpass over the St. Louis and San Francisco Railroad tracks and the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railroad tracks on Fifth Avenue, Northeast, between A Street Northeast and F Street, Northeast; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the qualified voters of said City, 2,551 votes, of which 1,650 were in favor of and 883 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 18 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of Three Hundred Thousand ($300,000.00) Dollars, which said bonds shall be designated, "Overpass Bonds of 1965," and shall be sixty in number, numbered One to Sixty, both inclusive, shall be dated on June 1, 1965, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each and become due and payable and bear interest from their date until paid as follows: 
$15,000 due 6-1-67 @ 31/4% 
 15,000 due 6-1-68 @ 31/4% 
 15,000 due 6-1-69 @ 31/4% 
 15,000 due 6-1-70 @ 3.00% 
 15,000 due 6-1-71 @ 3.00% 
 15,000 due 6-1-72 @ 2 7/8 % 
 15,000 due 6-1-73 @ 2 7/8 % 
 15,000 due 6-1-74 @ 2 7/8 % 
 15,000 due 6-1-75 @ 2 7/8 % 
 15,000 due 6-1-76 @ 2 7/8 % 
$15,000 due 6-1-77 @ 2.95% 
 15,000 due 6-1-78 @ 2.95% 
 15,000 due 6-1-79 @ 3.00% 
 15,000 due 6-1-80 @ 3.00% 
 15,000 due 6-1-81 @ 3.00% 
 15,000 due 6-1-82 @ 3.05% 
 15,000 due 6-1-83 @ 3.05% 
 15,000 due 6-1-84 @ 3.05% 
 15,000 due 6-1-85 @ 3.10% 
 15,000 due 6-1-86 @ 3.10% 
    Such interest shall be payable semi-annually on the 1st day of June and December in each year; except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of June, 1966, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at the First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
OVERPASS BOND OF 1965 
No. _____       $5,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, in the State of Oklahoma, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of FIVE THOUSAND ($5,000.00) DOLLARS, on the 1st day of June, A. D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually on the 1st day of June and December of each year, except the first coupon is due June 1, 1966; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue numbered from One to Sixty, both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to date of maturity and rate of interest, aggregating the principal sum of THREE HUNDRED THOUSAND ($300,000.00) DOLLARS, and is issued for the purpose of constructing an overpass over the St. Louis and San Francisco Railroad tracks and the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railroad tracks on Fifth Avenue, Northeast, between A Street, Northeast and F Street, Northeast, under Section 26, Article 10 of the Constitution of Oklahoma, Title 11, Section 645, Oklahoma Statutes, 1961, and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, Complementary, supplementary and enacted, pursuant thereto. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions and things required to be done, precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular, and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond and the series of which it forms a part, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the seal thereof this 1st day of June, A. D., 1965.

ORDINANCE NO. 1530 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF SERIES B WATERWORKS BONDS IN THE SUM OF SEVEN HUNDRED EIGHTY-ONE THOUSAND ($781,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, BEING THE REMAINDER OF A TOTAL ISSUE OF $1,381,000.00, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 15th day of December, 1964, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified property taxpaying voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of One Million, Three Hundred Eighty-one Thousand ($1,381,000.00) Dollars to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the water system, to be owned exclusively by said City; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the qualified property taxpaying voters of said City, 2,659 votes, of which 2,133 were in favor of and 521 were against the issuance of said bonds, and five were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified property taxpaying voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized; and 
    WHEREAS, on the 26th day of January, 1965, the City Commission of the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, sold $600,000.00 of the total authorized issue, said bonds being designated Series A Waterworks Bonds of 1965; and 
    WHEREAS, on the 15th day of March, 1966, the City Commission of the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, in regular session, did consider and adopt a resolution wherein it was adjudged by the City Commission that it was for the best interests of the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, that the remaining $781,000.00 of the total authorized issue be sold at this time. Said resolution further provided that said $781,000.00 bonds be designated "Series B Waterworks Bonds" and said bonds were duly sold on the 28th day of March, 1966. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of SEVEN HUNDRED EIGHTY-ONE THOUSAND ($781,000.00) DOLLARS, which said bonds shall be designated, "Series B Waterworks Bonds of 1966" and shall be one hundred fifty-six in number, numbered One to One Hundred Fifty-six. both inclusive, shall be dated on May 1, 1966, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each, except Bond No. 156, which shall be for $6,000.00, and become due and payable and bear interest per annum from their date until paid as follows: 
    $40,000.00 due May 1st, in each of the years, 1968 to 1973, inclusive, at 3.50%. 
    $40,000.00 due May 1st, in each of the years, 1974 to 1986, inclusive, at 3.60%. 
    $21,000.00 due May 1st, 1987, at 3.60%. 
    Such interest shall be payable semi-annually on the 1st day of May and November in each year; except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of May, 1967, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE

No. _____.       $ _____.

________ DOLLARS 
on the 1st day of May, A.D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually on the 1st day of May and November of each year, except the first coupon is due May 1, 1967; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York.

ORDINANCE NO. 1562 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF SANITARY SEWER BONDS IN THE SUM OF FOUR HUNDRED NINETY THOUSAND ($490,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 21st day of March, 1967, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified property taxpaying voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of Four Hundred Ninety Thousand ($490,000.00) Dollars to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the sanitary sewer system, to be owned exclusively by said City; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the qualified property taxpaying voters of said City, 2757 votes, of which 1534 were in favor of and 1190 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 33 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified property taxpaying voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of Four Hundred Ninety Thousand ($490,000.00) Dollars, which said bonds shall be designated, "Sanitary Sewer Bonds of 1967," and shall be Ninety-eight in number, numbered One to Ninety-eight, both inclusive, shall be dated on July 1, 1967, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each and become due and payable and bear interest from their date until paid as follows: 
$55,000.00 due 7-1-1969 @ 4.00% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1970 @ 3.50% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1971 @ 3.00% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1972 @ 3.00% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1973 @ 3.05% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1974 @ 3.05% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1975 @ 3.10% 
 55,000.00 due 7-1-1976 @ 3.10% 
 50,000.00 due 7-1-1977 @ 3.10% 
    Such interest shall be payable semi-annually on the 1st day of January and July in each year; except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of July, 1968, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached. and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
SANITARY SEWER BOND OF 1967 
No. _____       $5,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, in the State of Oklahoma, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of FIVE THOUSAND ($5,000.00) DOLLARS, on the 1st day of July, A.D.. 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually on the 1st day of January and July of each year, except the first coupon is due July 1, 1968; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue numbered from One to Ninety-eight, both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to date of maturity and rate of interest, aggregating the principal sum of FOUR HUNDRED NINETY THOUSAND DOLLARS ($490,000.00) and is issued for the purpose of extending and improving the sanitary sewer system, to be owned exclusively by said City, under Section 27, of Article 10, of the Constitution and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, complementary, supplementary and enacted, pursuant thereto. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions and things required to be done, precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond and the series of which it forms a part, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the seal thereof this 1st day of July, A.D., 1967.

    Section 3. That each of said bonds shall be signed by the Mayor and the corporate seal of said City affixed thereto and attested by the City Clerk of said City and each of said interest coupons shall be executed by the lithographed facsimile signatures of said Mayor and City Clerk; that said officers be and are hereby authorized and directed to cause said bonds and interest coupons to be prepared and to execute the same for and on behalf of said City; have the same registered by the City Treasurer, endorsed by the County Clerk and District Attorney, and presented to the Attorney-General, Ex-Officio Bond Commissioner, together with a certified transcript of all proceedings had in connection with their issue, for his approval and endorsement; that thereupon said bonds shall be delivered to the purchasers, Liberty National Bank and Trust, Co., Oklahoma City, Exchange National Bank and Trust Co., Ardmore, Oklahoma, and R. J. Edwards, Inc., Oklahoma City, upon payment of the purchase price thereof, which shall not be less than par and accrued interest. 
    The proceeds derived from the sale of said bonds shall be placed in a special fund and used solely for the purpose of providing funds for the purpose set out in Section 2 hereof. 
    Section 4. That beginning with the year 1968, a continuing annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on said bonds when due and for the purpose of providing a sinking fund with which to pay the principal of said bonds when due shall be and is hereby ordered levied upon all taxable property of said City, in addition to all other taxes, said sinking fund to be designated, "The Sanitary Sewer Bonds of 1967, Sinking Fund." 
    Said tax shall be and is hereby ordered certified, levied and extended upon the tax rolls and collected by the same officers, in the same manner and at the same time as the taxes for general purposes in each of said years are certified, levied, extended and collected; that all funds derived from said tax shall be placed in said sinking fund, which, together with all interest collected on same, shall be irrevocably pledged to the payment of the interest on and principal of said bonds when and as the same fall due. 
    Section 5. That by reason of said City being without adequate sanitary sewer facilities, it is deemed and hereby declared necessary for the preservation of the public health, peace and safety, that said bonds be issued without delay and to that end that this Ordinance shall become operative immediately; wherefore an emergency is hereby declared to exist and this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect immediately from and after its passage, approval and publication. 
    Passed the 15th day of May, A.D., 1967. 
    Approved the 15th day of May, A.D., 1967.

ORDINANCE NO. 1600 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS IN THE SUM OF SIX HUNDRED FIFTEEN THOUSAND ($615,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS; PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 24th day of September, 1968, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified property tax-paying voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY-FIVE THOUSAND ($455,000.00) DOLLARS, to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the water system, to be owned exclusively by said City, and in the sum of ONE HUNDRED SIXTY THOUSAND ($160,000.00) DOLLARS, to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the sanitary sewer system, to be owned exclusively by said City; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board, at said election there were cast by the qualified property tax-paying voters of said City on the waterworks question 4063 votes, of which 3696 were in favor of and 230 were against the issuance of the bonds, and 137 were mutilated ballots; and on the sanitary sewer question, 4316 votes, of which 3997 were in favor of and 259 were against the issuance of the bonds, and 60 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified property tax-paying voters voting on each of said propositions cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City, in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of SIX HUNDRED FIFTEEN THOUSAND ($615,000.00) DOLLARS, which said bonds shall be designated "General Obligation Bonds of 1969", shall be one hundred twenty-three, in number, numbered One to One Hundred Twenty-three, both inclusive, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each; shall be dated March 1, 1969, and become due and payable and bear interest from their date per annum until paid as follows: 
$15,000.00 due March 1, 1971, at 5.00% 
$50,000.00 due March 1, 1972, at 5.00% 
$50,000.00 due March 1, 1973, at 4.75% 
$50,000.00 due March 1, in each of the years, 1974 to 1979, inclusive, at 4.00% 
$50,000.00 due March 1, 1980, at 4.05% 
$50,000.00 due March 1, 1981, at 4.10% 
$50,000.00 due March 1, 1982 and 1983, at 4.15% 
    Such interest shall be payable semiannually on the 1st day of March and September in each year, except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of March, 1970, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of such Agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N.A., in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
GENERAL OBLIGATION BOND OF 1969 
No. _____       $5,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of 
FIVE THOUSAND ($5,000.00) DOLLARS 
on the 1st day of March, A.D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semiannually on the 1st day of March and September of each year, except that the first coupon is due March 1, 1970; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of such Agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N.A., in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue numbered from One to One Hundred Twenty-three, both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to date of maturity and rate of interest, aggregating the principal sum of SIX HUNDRED FIFTEEN THOUSAND ($615,000.00) DOLLARS; and is issued pursuant to an election held September 24, 1968, at which election the qualified property taxpaying voters approved two separate propositions, one on the question of incurring an indebtedness in the sum of Four Hundred Fifty-five Thousand ($455,000.00) Dollars, to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the water system, to be owned exclusively by said City, and one on the question of incurring an indebtedness in the sum of One Hundred Sixty Thousand ($160,000.00) Dollars, to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the sanitary sewer system, to be owned exclusively by said City under Section 27, Article 10, of the Constitution and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, complementary, supplementary, and enacted pursuant thereto. Each of the aforementioned sums has been placed in a separate special fund to be used only in the respective amount, and for the respective purpose as provided in the separate propositions and for no other purpose. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions, and things required to be done, precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond, and the series of which it forms a part, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the seal thereof this 1st day of March, A.D., 1969.

$455,000.00 Waterworks

    Section 4.     Said tax shall be and is hereby ordered certified, levied and extended upon the tax rolls and collected by the same officers, in the same manner and at the same time as the taxes for general purposes in each of said years are certified, levied, extended and collected; that all funds derived from said tax shall be placed in said sinking fund, which, together with all interest collected on same, shall be irrevocably pledged to the payment of the interest on and principal of said bonds when and as the same fall due. 
    Section 5. ORDINANCE NO. 1601 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF LIMITED ACCESS FACILITY BONDS IN THE SUM OF ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY-FIVE THOUSAND ($185,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 24th day of September, 1968, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the registered qualified voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY-FIVE THOUSAND ($185,000.00) DOLLARS, to provide funds for the purpose of acquiring and constructing a limited access facility, all as defined and included in the limited access facility system of said City, as established by Ordinance No. 1585 of said City, constituting the amount that the limited access facility exceeds the benefits to the property served thereby; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the registered qualified voters of said City 4991 votes, of which 4611 were in favor of and 336 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 44 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, more than three-fifths of the qualified voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY-FIVE THOUSAND ($185,000.00) DOLLARS, which said bonds shall be designated "Limited Access Facility Bonds of 1969" and shall be thirty-seven in number, numbered One to Thirty-seven, both inclusive, shall be dated March 1, 1969, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each, and become due and payable and bear interest per annum from their date until paid as follows: 
$5,000.00 due March 1, 1971, at 5.00% 
$15,000.00 due March 1, 1972, at 5.00% 
$15,000.00 due March 1, 1973, at 4.75% 
$15,000.00 due March 1, in each of the years, 1974 to 1979, inclusive, at 4.00% 
$15,000.00 due March 1, 1980, at 4.05% 
$15,000.00 due March 1, 1981, at 4.10% 
$15,000.00 due March 1, 1982 and 1983, at 4.15% 
    Such interest shall be payable semi-annually on the 1st day of March and September of each year, except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of March, 1970, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of such agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N.A., in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND)

    I hereby certify that I have examined a certified copy of the record of proceedings taken preliminary to and in the issuance of the within bond; that such proceedings and such bond show lawful authority for the issue and are in accordance with the forms and methods of procedure prescribed and provided by me for the issuance of bonds of like kind; and that said bond is a valid and binding obligation according to its tenor and terms, and under the provisions of Title 62, Oklahoma Statutes 1961, Sections 11, 13 and 14, requiring the certificate of the bond commissioner of the State of Oklahoma thereon, is incontestable in any court in the State of Oklahoma unless suit thereon shall be brought in a court having jurisdiction of the same within thirty days from the date of this approval of said bond appearing in the caption hereto. 
_____
Attorney-General, Ex-Officio Bond 
Commissioner of the 
State of Oklahoma 
    Section 3. That each of said bonds shall be signed by the Mayor and the corporate seal of said City affixed thereto and attested by the City Clerk of said City and each of said interest coupons shall be executed by the lithographed facsimile signatures of said Mayor and City Clerk; that said officers be and are hereby authorized and directed to cause said bonds and interest coupons to be prepared and to execute the same for and on behalf of said City; have the same registered by the City Treasurer, endorsed by the County Clerk and District Attorney, and presented to the Attorney-General, Ex-Officio Bond Commissioner, together with a certified transcript of all proceedings had in connection with their issue, for his approval and endorsement; that thereupon said bonds shall be delivered to the purchaser, The Liberty National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, and associates upon payment of the purchase price thereof, which shall not be less than par and accrued interest. 
    The proceeds derived from the sale of said bonds shall be placed in a special fund and used solely for the purpose of providing funds for the purpose set out in Section 2 hereof. 
    Section 4. That beginning with the year 1969, a continuing annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on said bonds when due and for the purpose of providing a sinking fund with which to pay the principal of said bonds when due shall be and is hereby ordered levied upon all taxable property of said City, in addition to all other taxes, said sinking fund to be designated, "The Limited Access Facility Bonds of 1969, Sinking Fund." Said tax shall be and is hereby ordered certified, levied and extended upon the tax rolls and collected by the same officers, in the same manner and at the same time as the taxes for general purposes in each of said years are certified, levied, extended and collected; that all funds derived from said tax shall be placed in said sinking fund, which, together with all interest collected on same, shall be irrevocably pledged to the payment of the interest on and principal of said bonds when and as the same fall due. 
    Section 5. That by reason of said City being without an adequate limited access facility, it is deemed and hereby declared necessary for the preservation of the public health, peace and safety, that said bonds be issued without delay and to that end that this Ordinance shall become operative immediately; wherefore an emergency is hereby declared to exist and this Ordinance shall be in full force and effect immediately from and after its passage, approval and publication. 
    Passed the 21st day of January, A.D., 1969. 
    Approved the 21st day of January, A.D., 1969. 
/s/ SCOTT F. KING

ORDINANCE NO. 1746 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF WATER SYSTEM BONDS, SERIES A, IN THE SUM OF ONE MILLION, THREE HUNDRED SEVENTEEN THOUSAND ($1,317,000.00) DOLLARS, BEING PART OF A TOTAL AUTHORIZED ISSUE OF ONE MILLION, THREE HUNDRED SEVENTEEN THOUSAND, NINE HUNDRED EIGHTY ($1,317,980.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BONDS, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 24th day of September, 1968, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified property tax-paying voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of One Million, Three Hundred Seventeen Thousand, Nine Hundred Eighty ($1,317,980.00) Dollars to provide funds for the purpose of purchasing and installing of pumping stations and water mains from the Lake of the Arbuckles to the Ardmore Industrial Airpark and from the Ardmore Industrial Airpark to connect to the water distribution system of the City of Ardmore, the same to be owned and controlled exclusively by the City of Ardmore; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the qualified property tax-paying voters of said City 4,527 votes, of which 4,212 were in favor of and 284 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 31 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, it was provided in the ballot that approval of the foregoing proposition shall be ineffective unless the proposition concerning contract for the acquisition of water rights also be approved simultaneously at said election; and such latter proposition was approved at said election; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the qualified property tax-paying voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized; and 
    WHEREAS, on the 18th day of March, 1974, the City Commission of the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, in regular session, did consider and adopt a Resolution wherein it was adjudged by the City Commission that it was for the best interests of the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, that only $1,317,000.00 bonds be sold at this time. Such resolution further provided that said $1,317,000.00 of the total authorized issue of $1,317,980.00 be designated Water System Bonds, Series A, and said bonds were duly sold on the 8th day of April, 1974. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, be it ordained by the Commission of the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of One Million, Three Hundred Seventeen Thousand ($1,317,000.00) Dollars, which said bonds shall be designated "Water System Bonds Series A of 1974" and shall be 263 in number, numbered One to 263, both inclusive, shall be dated June 1, 1974, of the denomination of $5,000.00 each except bond Number One which shall be of the denomination of $7,000.00 and become due and payable as follows: $117,000.00 on June 1, 1976, and $150,000.00 on June 1 in each of the years 1977 to 1984, both inclusive, and bear interest per annum from their date until paid as follows: 
$117,000.00 on June 1, 1976 at 4.50 per cent per annum 
$150,000.00 on June 1, in each of the years 1977 to 1982, both inclusive, at 4.50 per cent per annum, and 
$150,000.00 on June 1, 1983 and 1984 at 4.55 per cent per annum. 
    Such interest shall be payable semi-annually on the 1st day of June and December in each year, except the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of June, 1975, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at the Chase Manhattan Bank, N.A., in said City and State of New York. (Ord. No. 1746-A, § 1, 5-28-74) 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
WATER SYSTEM BOND SERIES A OF 1974 
No. _____       $_____ 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, in the State of Oklahoma, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of 
___________ DOLLARS, 
On the 1st day of June, A.D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually on the 1st day of June and December of each year, except the first coupon is due June 1, 1975; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Oklahoma City, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N.A., in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue designated Water System Bonds Series A of 1974, in the aggregate amount of One Million, Three Hundred Seventeen Thousand ($1,317,000.00) Dollars, being part of a total authorized issue of One Million, Three Hundred Seventeen Thousand, Nine Hundred Eighty (1,317,980.00) Dollars, numbered from One to 263, both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to denomination, date of maturity and rate of interest, and is issued for the purpose of purchasing and installing of pumping stations and water mains from the Lake of the Arbuckles to the Ardmore Industrial Airpark and from the Ardmore Industrial Airpark to connect to the water distribution system of the City of Ardmore, the same to be owned and controlled exclusively by the City of Ardmore, under Section 27, Article 10, of the Constitution and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, complementary, supplementary and enacted pursuant thereto. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions and things required to be done precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond and the series of which it forms a part, and the unissued portion of said authorized issue, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the seal thereof this 1st day of June, A.D., 1974. 
_____
Mayor 
(SEAL) 
ATTEST: _____
City Clerk

ORDINANCE NO. 1832 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF WATER SYSTEM EXTENSION AND IMPROVEMENT BONDS IN THE SUM OF SEVEN MILLION ($7,000,000.00) DOLLARS BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, CARTER COUNTY, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING FORM OF BOND, PROVIDING LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON THE SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 3rd day of August, 1976, pursuant to notice duly given, an election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, State of Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the registered qualified voters the question of the issuance of the bonds of said City in the sum of Seven Million ($7,000,000.00) Dollars to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the water system, to be owned exclusively by said City; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the canvass of the returns by the County Election Board at said election, there were cast by the registered qualified voters of said City 3,376 votes, of which 1,855 were in favor of and 1,493 were against the issuance of said bonds, and 28 were mutilated ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the registered qualified voters voting on said proposition cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said bonds, the issuance thereof has been duly authorized. 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of said City in accordance with the form as hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of Seven Million ($7,000,000.00) Dollars, which said bonds shall be designated, "Water System Extension and Improvement Bonds of 1976," and shall be One Thousand Four Hundred (1,400) in number, numbered from One to One Thousand Four Hundred, both inclusive, of the denomination of Five Thousand ($5,000.00) Dollars each, shall be dated November 1st, 1976, and become due and payable as follows: 
$1,200,000.00 on November 1st in each of the years 1979 to 1983, inclusive, and 
$1,000,000.00 on November 1st, 1984, 
and bear interest from their date until paid as follows: 
$1,200,000.00 due November 1st, 1979, at 5.25 per cent per annum 
$1,200,000.00 due November 1st, 1980, at 3.90 per cent per annum 
$1,200,000.00 due November 1st, 1981, at 4.10 per cent per annum 
$1,200,000.00 due November 1st, 1982, at 4.20 per cent per annum 
$1,200,000.00 due November 1st, 1983, at 4.25 per cent per annum 
$1,000,000.00 due November 1st, 1984, at 4.375 per cent per annum 
such interest payable semi-annually on the 1st day of May and November of each year, except that the first coupons shall mature on the 1st day of May, 1978, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable in lawful money of the United States of America at Fidelity Bank, N.A., State of Oklahoma; or at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N. A. in said City and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said bonds, the coupons thereto attached, and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
(FORM OF BOND) 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
THE CITY OF ARDMORE 
WATER SYSTEM EXTENSION AND IMPROVEMENT 
BOND OF 1976 
No. _____       $5,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, in the State of Oklahoma, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received promises to pay to the bearer the sum of FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS ($5,000.00) on the 1st day of November, A. D., 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid, at the rate of _____ per centum per annum, payable semi-annually on the 1st day of May and November of each year, except that the first coupon shall mature on the 1st day of May, 1978; said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at ___________, State of Oklahoma; or at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of said agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N. A., in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue numbered from One to One Thousand Four Hundred, both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to date of maturity and rate of interest, aggregating the principal sum of SEVEN MILLION ($7,000,000.00) DOLLARS, and is issued for the purpose of Extending and Improving the Water System, to be owned exclusively by said City, under Section 27, of Article 10, of the Constitution and Statutes of the State of Oklahoma, complementary, supplementary and enacted pursuant thereto. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions and things required to be done, precedent to and in the issuance of this bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this bond and the series of which it forms a part, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitation; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF said City has caused this bond to be signed by its Mayor, by facsimile signature, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the facsimile seal thereof this 1st day of November, A. D., 1976.

ORDINANCE NO. 2095 
"AN ORDINANCE PROVIDING FOR THE ISSUANCE OF $7,500,000 GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS OF 1983 ("Series A") BY THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA, AUTHORIZED AT AN ELECTION DULY CALLED AND HELD FOR SUCH PURPOSE; PRESCRIBING THE FORM OF SAID BONDS; PROVIDING FOR THE LEVY OF AN ANNUAL TAX FOR THE PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL AND INTEREST ON SAME; FIXING OTHER DETAILS OF THE ISSUE; AND DECLARING AN EMERGENCY." 
    WHEREAS, on the 7th day of December, 1982, pursuant to notice duly given, a special election was held in the City of Ardmore, Carter County, Oklahoma, for the purpose of submitting to the qualified voters the question of the issuance of General Obligation Bonds of said City; and 
    WHEREAS, the issuance of $11,000,000 General Obligation Bonds of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma, as follows: $10,000,000 to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the sewer system of said City; and $1,000,000 to provide funds for the purpose of extending and improving the water system of said City; said systems to be owned exclusively by said City, was authorized, in separate propositions, at said special election held for that purpose on the 7th day of December, 1982; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the Canvass of Returns by the Carter County Election Board, at said election there were cast by the registered, qualified voters of said City voting on Sewer Proposition No. 1, 2,834 votes of which 2,090 were in favor of and 744 were against the issuance of said Bonds, and 163 were mutilated, spoiled or not voted ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, as shown by the Canvass of Returns by the Carter County Election Board, at said election there were cast by the registered, qualified voters of said City voting on Water Proposition No. 2, 2,863 votes of which 2,082 were in favor of and 781 were against the issuance of said Bonds, and 135 were mutilated, spoiled or not voted ballots; and 
    WHEREAS, a lawful majority of the registered, qualified voters voting on the propositions cast their ballots in favor of the issuance of said Bonds and the issuance thereof has been duly authorized; and 
    WHEREAS, the City Commission of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma, has determined that the issuance of $6,500,000 Sewer System Bonds, of a total authorized issue of $10,000,000, for the purpose of extending and improving the sewer system of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma; and $1,000,000 Water System Bonds, of a total authorized issue of $1,000,000, for the purpose of extending and improving the water system of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma, is necessary at this time, and they are therefore offering for sale at this time, and at this place $6,500,000 Sewer System Bonds and $1,000,000 Water System Bonds, combined in one issue of General Obligation Bonds, to effect the necessary extensions and improvements to the City's sewer and water systems; and 
    WHEREAS, it is deemed advisable by the governing body of said municipality to issue said Bonds as a single issue of $7,500,000 General Obligation Bonds of 1983 ("Series A"), as authorized by Title 62, Oklahoma Statutes 1981, Section 354; 
    NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE CITY COMMISSION OF THE CITY OF ARDMORE, STATE OF OKLAHOMA: 
    Section 1. That there are hereby ordered and directed to be issued the negotiable coupon bonds of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma, in accordance with the forms hereinafter set out, in the aggregate amount of SEVEN MILLION FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($7,500,000.00) which said Bonds shall be designated, "GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS OF 1983 ("SERIES A"), and shall be One Thousand Five Hundred (1,500) in number, numbered from One to One Thousand Five Hundred (1 to 1,500) both inclusive, of the denomination of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00) each, shall be dated April 1, 1983, and become due and payable as follows: 
$500,000.00 on April 1, 1986, and $1,000,000.00 in each of the years 1987 to 1993, both inclusive, 
and bear interest from their date until paid as follows: 
    $500,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1986 at 10.00% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1987 at 8.15% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1988 at 6.60% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1989 at 7.00% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1990 at 7.30% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1991 at 7.50% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1992 at 7.50% per annum 
$1,000,000.00 maturing on April 1, 1993 at 7.50% per annum 
such interest being payable semi-annually on the 1st day of April and October of each year, except that the first coupon shall mature on the 1st day of April, 1984, which installments of interest to date of maturity of principal shall be evidenced by appropriate coupons attached to each of said bonds, and both principal and interest shall be payable at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Tulsa, Tulsa, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York, or, in the event of the discontinuance of such Agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N. A., in said city and State of New York. 
    Section 2. That each of said Bonds, the coupons thereto attached and the endorsements and certificates thereon shall be in substantially the following form: 
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA 
STATE OF OKLAHOMA 
CITY OF ARDMORE 
GENERAL OBLIGATION BOND OF 1983 ("SERIES A") 
No. _____       $5,000.00 
    KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That the City of Ardmore, State of Oklahoma, a body corporate, hereby acknowledges itself indebted to and for value received, promises to pay the bearer the sum of FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS ($5,000.00) on the first day of April, 19___, together with interest thereon from the date hereof until paid at the rate of _____ percentum (_____%) per annum, payable semi-annually on the first day of April and October of each year, except that the first interest coupon shall mature on the first day of April, 1984, said interest evidenced by and to be paid upon the surrender of the coupons hereto attached as they severally become due, both principal and interest payable in lawful money of the United States of America at The First National Bank and Trust Company of Tulsa, Tulsa, State of Oklahoma; or, at the option of the holder, at the Fiscal Agency of the State of Oklahoma, in the City of New York, State of New York; or, in the event of the discontinuance of such Agency, then at The Chase Manhattan Bank, N. A., in said City and State of New York. 
    THE FULL FAITH, CREDIT AND RESOURCES of said City are hereby irrevocably pledged to the payment of this bond. 
    THIS BOND is one of an issue numbered from One to One Thousand Five Hundred (1 to 1,500) both inclusive, of like date and tenor, except as to rate of interest and date of maturity, designated "General Obligation Bonds of 1983 ("Series A") in the aggregate amount of SEVEN MILLION FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($7,500,000.00). The foregoing issue of bonds is a combination of two different purposes as follows: $6,500,000.00 Sewer System Bonds of a total authorized issue of $10,000,000.00, for the purpose of extending and improving the sewer system of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma; and $1,000,000.00 Water System Bonds of a total authorized issue of $1,000,000.00, for the purpose of extending and improving the water system of the City of Ardmore, Oklahoma, as approved by a majority of the registered qualified voters in separate propositions at an election held for that purpose on the 7th day of December, 1982; said improvements and extensions of the sewer and water systems of said City to be owned exclusively by the City or Ardmore, Oklahoma, under Section 27, Article X of the Constitution and other statutes of the State complementary, supplementary and enacted pursuant thereto. 
    The proceeds of the Bonds have been placed in separate special funds to be used only for the purposes provided in the propositions and for no other purposes. 
    IT IS HEREBY CERTIFIED AND RECITED that all acts, conditions, and things required to be done precedent to and in the issuance of this Bond have been properly done, happened and been performed in regular and due form and time as required by law, and that the total indebtedness of said City, including this Bond, and the series of which it forms a part, does not exceed any constitutional or statutory limitations; and that due provision has been made for the collection of an annual tax sufficient to pay the interest on this Bond as it falls due and also to constitute a sinking fund for the payment of the principal hereof at maturity. 
    IN WITNESS WHEREOF, said City has caused this Bond to be signed by the facsimile signature of the Mayor, attested by its Clerk, and sealed with the facsimile seal thereof, and has caused the coupons affixed hereto to be signed by the facsimile signatures of said officials, this 1st day of April, 1983. 
_____
Mayor 
(SEAL) 
ATTEST: _____
City Clerk

A., in said City and State of New York, for interest due that day on its General Obligation Bond of 1983 ("Series A") of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00), dated April 1, 1983.

    I HEREBY CERTIFY that I have examined a certified copy of the record of proceedings taken preliminary to and in the issuance of the within named Bond; that such proceedings and such Bond show lawful authority for the issue and are in accordance with the forms and method of procedure prescribed and provided by me for the issuance of bonds of like kind; and that said Bond is a valid and binding obligation according to its tenor and terms; and under the provisions of Title 62, Oklahoma Statutes 1981, Sections 11, 13 and 14, requiring the certificate of the Bond Commissioner of the State of Oklahoma thereon, is incontestable in any Court in the State of Oklahoma unless suit thereon shall be brought in a Court having jurisdiction of the same within thirty (30) days from the date of this approval of said Bond appearing in the caption hereto.
